channel.title: Bloomberg Technology

item.title: Oracle Sees ‘Dramatically Higher’ Sales, Boosting Cloud Momentum
item.description: Oracle Corp. projected cloud infrastructure sales will jump more than 70% in the fiscal year that began this month, boosting shares in late trading on investor enthusiasm for the closely watched business.
item.dc:creator: Brody Ford

media:content.media:description: The Oracle offices in Redwood City, California.

item.title: Social Media Firms Accountable for Posts, Brazil Judges Conclude
item.description: Brazil’s Supreme Court formed a majority in favor of further regulating social media companies, the latest effort by authorities to hold tech giants accountable for illegal content posted on their platforms.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Rosati, Daniel Carvalho

media:content.media:description: Supreme Court Justice Alexandre de Moraes

item.title: Meta Taps Top Researchers From Google, Sesame for New AI Lab
item.description: Meta Platforms Inc. has poached top engineers from multiple tech firms, including Alphabet Inc.’s Google, for a new team focused on achieving a more advanced form of AI called artificial general intelligence.
item.dc:creator: Shirin Ghaffary, Kurt Wagner, Riley Griffin

media:content.media:description: The Meta Platforms Inc. pavilion ahead of the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland.

item.title: Diller’s IAC in $30 Million Settlement Over Match.com Spinoff
item.description: Barry Diller’s IAC agreed to a $30 million settlement to resolve claims that investors were shortchanged in its spinoff of Match Group Inc., which operates dating apps including Tinder and Hinge.
item.dc:creator: Jef Feeley, Mike Leonard

media:content.media:description: Tesla CEO Elon Musk

item.title: Space Firm Voyager Technologies Jumps 82% After Upsized IPO
item.description: Voyager Technologies Inc. shares ended their debut trading day up 82% after the company raised $383 million in an upsized US initial public offering.
item.dc:creator: Norah Mulinda, Anthony Hughes

media:content.media:description: Voyager Technologies signage outside the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) during the company's initial public offering (IPO) in New York, US, on Wednesday, June 11, 2025. Voyager Technologies Inc. is seeking to raise as much as $319 million in an initial public offering, as it looks to capitalize on rising government spending on advanced defense technologies and space exploration.

item.title: The Mystery Behind Notorious Russian Hacker DukeEugene
item.dc:creator: Patrick Howell O'Neill

item.title: Nvidia CEO Sees Tenfold Boost to Europe’s AI Computing Power
item.description: Nvidia Corp. Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang projected that Europe’s artificial-intelligence computing capacity will increase by a factor of ten over the next two years, with more than 20 so-called AI factories in the works.
item.dc:creator: Ian King, Benoit Berthelot

media:content.media:description: Jensen Huang Photographer: Nathan Laine/Bloomberg

item.title: US Makes Export Controls Negotiable as Part of China Trade Talks
item.description: Trade talks between the US and China this week cemented a seismic change in Washington’s approach to the countries’ economic relationship: US export curbs, meant to keep sensitive technologies out of Beijing’s hands, are now explicitly up for negotiation.
item.dc:creator: Jenny Leonard, Mackenzie Hawkins

media:content.media:description: Scott Bessent, US treasury secretary, second right, departs following trade talks at Lancaster House in London, UK, on Tuesday, June 10, 2025.

item.title: Paul Tudor Jones Fears AI Job Losses Will Worsen Social Division
item.description: Paul Tudor Jones said he’s concerned about potential societal fallout from artificial intelligence-driven job losses and urged politicians to consider how to best regulate the technology.
item.dc:creator: Amanda Cantrell, Katie Greifeld, Matthew Miller

media:content.media:description: Paul Tudor Jones, founder and chief executive officer of Tudor Investment Corp., speaks during the Robin Hood Benefit annual event in New York, US, on Monday, May 12, 2025.

item.title: Prosus Says Earnings Likely Doubled on E-Commerce, Tencent
item.description: Prosus NV said its earnings per share likely nearly doubled in the last fiscal year after growth at its e-commerce businesses accelerated and the value of its holding in Chinese internet company Tencent Holdings Ltd. surged.
item.dc:creator: Amy Thomson

media:content.media:description: A Prosus flag is displayed ahead of the trading debut of the new Prosus NV unit of Naspers Ltd., outside the Amsterdam Stock Exchange, operated by Euronext NV, in Amsterdam, Netherlands, on Wednesday, Sept. 11, 2019. Naspers will retain 73% of the new company, which will house everything from a 31% stake in Chinese online giant Tencent to food delivery and advertising firms from the U.S. to India and Brazil. Photographer: Jasper Juinen/Bloomberg

item.title: DoorDash to Buy Symbiosys to Boost Its $1 Billion-a-Year Ad Unit
item.description: DoorDash Inc. is adding to its recent buying spree by acquiring advertising tech firm Symbiosys for $175 million, bolstering an ad business that now generates more than $1 billion annually.
item.dc:creator: Natalie Lung, Spencer Soper

media:content.media:description: A DoorDash billboard in New York’s Times Square in 2023.

item.title: Alibaba Staff Worked Through Holiday After DeepSeek Breakthrough
item.description: Alibaba Group Holding Ltd.’s engineers canceled vacations and worked through the Lunar New Year holiday to play catch up after DeepSeek shocked the global tech industry with its low-cost, powerful artificial-intelligence model in January.
item.dc:creator: Debby Wu

media:content.media:description: Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. headquarters in Hangzhou, China.

item.title: US Replacing Huawei Towers in Panama to ‘Counter China’
item.description: The US embassy in Panama said it is replacing Huawei Technologies Co.’s telecommunication towers with US technology as the administration of Donald Trump intensifies its stance against China in the region.
item.dc:creator: Michael D McDonald

item.title: Uber Alleges Insurance Fraud Scheme in Florida as It Goes on Legal Offensive
item.description: Uber Technologies Inc. sued a group of lawyers, medical providers and rideshare drivers it claims staged car accidents, manufactured damages and received unnecessary medical procedures to take advantage of insurance policies in Florida, costing the rideshare giant “several million dollars” in legal fees.
item.dc:creator: Natalie Lung

media:content.media:description: Uber signage on a vehicle in New York.

item.title: Disney, Comcast Sue AI Image Generator Midjourney
item.description: Walt Disney Co. and Comcast Corp. teamed up to sue Midjourney Inc., accusing the startup of copyright infringement in the latest sign of tension between major media companies and a new crop of artificial intelligence businesses.
item.dc:creator: Lucas Shaw

media:content.media:description: A person uses an ai image generation program in Tokyo.

item.title: Inside the ‘Dragon Age’ Debacle That Gutted EA’s BioWare Studio
item.description: The latest game in BioWare’s fantasy role-playing series went through ten years of development turmoil
item.dc:creator: Jason Schreier

media:content.media:description: The failure of Dragon Age: The Veilguard, released in October, led EA to gut BioWare

item.title: Air Conditioning Drives New India Power Demand, Green CEO Says
item.description: The biggest source of new electricity demand in India is coming from air conditioning, outpacing transport and data centers.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Morison

media:content.media:description: Air conditioning units in New Delhi.

item.title: Altman-Backed Robot Delivery Startup Raises $80 Million in Funding
item.description: Coco Robotics, a startup that operates a fleet of cooler-sized delivery robots on wheels, has raised $80 million in funding from OpenAI Chief Executive Officer Sam Altman and other backers, a sign that automated delivery technology is advancing. The financing, which Coco Robotics plans to announce Wednesday, was led by venture capital firm SNR, with participation from investors including Pelion Venture Partners, Offline Ventures and one of Altman’s brothers, Max. With the new funding, Coco Robot
item.dc:creator: Rachel Metz

media:content.media:description: A Coco Robotics delivery cart. Source: Coco Robotics

item.title: African Backer of Tech Unicorns Eyes AI in Healthcare Deals
item.description: Chronos Capital, an early backer of emerging market unicorns Tyme Group and Optasia, is looking to invest in companies deploying artificial intelligence in healthcare as it seeks to capitalize on a technology that’s expected to transform the medical industry.
item.dc:creator: Prinesha Naidoo

media:content.media:description: AI signage.

item.title: DayOne Gets $3.5 Billion Funding for Johor Data Centers
item.description: DayOne Data Centers Singapore Pte. secured 15 billion ringgit ($3.5 billion) of multicurrency financing to support its green data centers in Malaysia’s Johor state, according to a statement from Oversea-Chinese Banking Corporation Ltd.
item.dc:creator: Ram Anand

media:content.media:description: Data center.

item.title: Databricks Eyes $1 Billion Sales for Data Warehousing Product
item.description: Databricks Inc., a software provider among the most valuable startup companies, said its data warehousing business is on track to nearly double in size this year, and it’s launching a new database product that it hopes will follow a similar growth trajectory.
item.dc:creator: Brody Ford

media:content.media:description: The Databricks Inc. website home screen on a smartphone arranged in the Brooklyn Borough of New York, U.S., on Monday, Jan. 4, 2021. A booming market for U.S. initial public offerings shows no sign of slowing in 2021. Software maker Databricks Inc. is aiming to go public in the first half of 2021, potentially tapping the same investors who sent Snowflake Inc.’s shares soaring this year. Photographer: Gabby Jones/Bloomberg

item.title: Amazon-Backed Rare Earths Startup to Build Recycling Plant in Canada
item.description: Cyclic Materials, a startup backed by Amazon.com Inc. and Microsoft Corp., announced plans to build a rare-earths recycling plant and research center in Canada.
item.dc:creator: Elise Harris

media:content.media:description: The Cyclic Materials Hub100 plant in Kingston, Ontario.

item.title: Nvidia’s Huang Sees Quantum Computing Reaching Inflection Point
item.description: Nvidia Corp. Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang said Wednesday that quantum computing is reaching an inflection point and will be powerful enough in the coming years to help “solve some interesting problems” globally.
item.dc:creator: Lynn Doan

media:content.media:description: Jensen Huang at the 2025 VivaTech conference in Paris, on June 11. Photographer: Nathan Laine/Bloomberg

item.title: Amazon, Walmart Drone Deliveries Take Rivalry to the Skies
item.description: Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Matt Day looks at the plans by Amazon and Walmart to significantly expand deliveries using drones.
item.dc:creator: Matt Day

media:content.media:description: A Prime Air MK30 drone. Source: Amazon

item.title: Nvidia Teams Up With G42 for UAE Data Centers in Mideast AI Push
item.description: Nvidia Corp. will collaborate with a G42 unit to build data centers powered by its Blackwell chips, a sign of how the United Arab Emirates’ access to the latest generation of semiconductors has improved since US President Donald Trump’s May trip to the Middle East.
item.dc:creator: Omar El Chmouri

media:content.media:description: An Nvidia Corp. GB200 Grace Blackwell superchip.

item.title: Nintendo Switch 2 Sets Sales Record in Boon for Games Sector
item.description: Nintendo Co. sold 3.5 million-plus units of the Switch 2 in just four days, a record-breaking start for the company’s first new console in eight years.
item.dc:creator: Takashi Mochizuki

media:content.media:description: A customer poses with a Nintendo Switch 2 game console at a Bic Camera Inc. electronics store in Tokyo on June 5.

item.title: Publicis Wins $1.7 Billion Mars Advertising Account From WPP
item.description: Publicis Groupe SA has won a major new client, snagging the $1.7 billion ad portfolio for M&Ms and Snickers owner Mars Inc. from WPP Plc, people familiar with the matter said.
item.dc:creator: Benoit Berthelot, Will Kubzansky

media:content.media:description: Mars Inc's M&Ms candy at a store in the Harlem neighborhood of New York, US, on Wednesday, Aug. 14, 2024. Mars Inc. agreed to buy Kellanova for nearly $36 billion including debt, bringing together two major food companies in the biggest deal of the year.

item.title: SoftBank-Backed Meesho Said to Plan IPO Filing in Coming Weeks
item.description: Indian e-commerce platform Meesho plans to confidentially file for an initial public offering in Mumbai in the coming weeks, people familiar with the matter said.
item.dc:creator: Baiju Kalesh, Rajesh Mascarenhas

media:content.media:description: The Meesho website.

item.title: Polygon Co-Founder Sandeep Nailwal Takes Over as Foundation CEO
item.description: Sandeep Nailwal, a co-founder of Polygon, has been appointed CEO of the blockchain project’s foundation to help sharpen its strategic focus.
item.dc:creator: Sidhartha Shukla

media:content.media:description: Sandeep Nailwal

item.title: Proxima Fusion Raises €130 Million to Become European Nuclear Champion
item.description: The company will use the funds to develop superconducting magnets that are a key component of the technology.
item.dc:creator: Mark Bergen

media:content.media:description: Proxima Fusion's office in Munich with a rendering of its planned stellarator.
